intro: Diplycosia kostermansii, commonly known as the Koster's diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It grows in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
